item.title: Britain and the Common Market: The Sterling Question
item.description: Book Chapter: In this text of a radio talk first broadcast on 19th February 1967, Strange summarises the arguments she made in (1967c). Discussing the links between Britain and the European Community, she examines the international position of sterling in a time of monetary crisis. Noting both the lack of reserves held by the British government and Britain’s extra-European financial commitments, Strange argues that de Gaulle may be correct in thinking it is impossible for Britain to act ‘like good Europeans’.
